an Amazon machine image and for those of you that are not aware of or amies as
they're typically referred to as an ami is basically a prepackaged set of
software components including an operating system application components
application servers whatever is required to deploy a software a piece of software
on an ec2 virtual server instance that's running in the gov cloud region from
that standpoint there are two options to deploy software in the Gov Claude region one is using community amies and the
second is using what we refer to as a private on me I'll walk through both here pretty shortly so a community ami
is basically an ami that's been developed and published in the gov cloud region that is available and
discoverable to all users and any customer of the gov cloud region itself so when a customer logs into their

are publicly available for them to use that is one option that software vendors
will use to distribute their software on the gov cloud region again because the AWS marketplace is not available today
in gov cloud the second option is the private army and private armies look
smell and feel just like community omni's the only difference is there is that they're not publicly discoverable

publish the army to gov cloud but they control access to those armies so the
